info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued January 02 at 4:47PM CST until January 02 at 8:15PM CST by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...A TORNADO WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 515 PM CST FOR WESTERN JACKSON...SOUTHEASTERN BIENVILLE AND SOUTHEASTERN LINCOLN PARISHES... At 446 PM CST, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located over Jonesboro, moving northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Tornado. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. This dangerous storm will be near... Jonesboro around 450 PM CST. Other locations impacted by this tornadic thunderstorm include East Hodge, Hodge, Choudrant, North Hodge and Quitman. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
